story.text: Five years earlier: December 18, 1988
Two years ago, the Kingdom of Olrez declared independence against the People's Socialist Republic of Ardonia.
The Kingdom of Olrez has long had a ruler, the Crown Queen of Olrez descended from a long line of rulers dating back to the small nation's first history.
Under Ardonian rule though, she served only as a figurehead to the nation and to deliver the Ardonian state's will to her people.
But now in the wake of the transition to independence, our nation temporarily reverted to it's pre-Ardonian government, with the Queen of Olrez reinstated into emergency power.
There are a few that do not see any future in the new government and remain loyal to the failing Ardonian Republic.
At first they gave protest, but soon they started organizing, collectively meeting to incite unrest.
And ultimately, the unrest finally reached a tipping point.

story.speaker: General Merlin
story.text: Right on time, isn't it?
The general sat across from me in the command vehicle, eyeing a few schematics of the building on the warm overhead.

story.speaker: Commander Spiellman
story.text: You knew this attack was coming?

story.speaker: General Merlin
story.text: Oh god no, If we did that entire site would've been under lockdown for the last 72 hours or so. If we did, State Intelligence is silence as usual...

story.speaker: General Merlin
story.text: I think everyone was anticpating something like this. With the amount of tension in the air.

story.speaker: General Merlin
story.text: A friend of mine on the Police Force is worried, the situation's become bad enough that she's arresting children for stealing bread.

story.speaker: Commander Spiellman
story.text: I don't suppose it was the children themselves who came up with the idea to steal bread.

story.speaker: General Merlin
story.text: No, I suppose it wasn't. But uncertainty in the future is the only parent here, isn't it?

story.speaker: Commander Spiellman
story.text: I dont' blame them. Cash can't even be used to purchase food right now. It's all melted down copper and silver stones I've traded from the merchant shops.

story.speaker: General Merlin
story.text: Dire times for all. Hopefully the Queen meeting with the emissary from The Irean Nations will solve a few issues.

story.speaker: General Merlin
story.text: By the way, don't sell your electronics.

story.speaker: Commander Spiellman
story.text: Why's that?

story.speaker: General Merlin
story.text: The Queen just ordered the Lanthanum mines under emergency state ownership. The price of cameras, lighters and battery powered watches might just skyrocket in the coming month.

story.speaker: Commander Spiellman
story.text: Lighters huh? Glad I use matches.

story.speaker: General Merlin
story.text: However, chit chat ends here. We've arrived.

story.speaker: General Merlin
story.text: Today, I think we find out the first hand price of our independence. Pray, that we do not witness it paid in blood.
